intro: Gutierrezia grandis, commonly known as the large leaf galleta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Gutierrezia grandis produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
